fields.info: DMA enable bit.

values.desc: The DMA is disabled.
The DMA is enabled.

fields.info: This bit indicates status of DMA external AHB bus status.

values.desc: DMA's external bus is busy in data transfers.

fields.info: Debug Mode.

values.desc: Ignore suspend.
Finish current block transfer.
Finish current frame transfer.
Immediately stop at an DMA arbitration boundary and continue after suspend.

fields.info: DMA software reset

values.desc: Software reset is disabled.
The DMA state machine and all control registers are in software reset.

fields.info: Channel pending register.
Status of DMA channels.

values.desc: The channel is inactive.
The channel is active; that is, the channel is currently in the DMA's execution queue.

registers.name: HWCHENAS
registers.info: HW Channel Enable Set and Status Register

fields.info: Hardware channel enable bit.

values.desc: The corresponding channel is disabled for hardware triggering.
The corresponding channel is enabled for hardware triggering.

registers.name: HWCHENAR
registers.info: HW Channel Enable Reset and Status Register

fields.info: HW channel disable bit.

values.desc: Read: The corresponding channel is disabled for HW triggering.
Read: The corresponding channel is enabled for HW triggering.

registers.name: SWCHENAS
registers.info: SW Channel Enable Set and Status Register

fields.info: SW channel enable bit.

values.desc: The corresponding channel is not triggered by SW request.
The corresponding channel is triggered by SW request.

registers.name: SWCHENAR
registers.info: SW Channel Enable Reset and Status Register

fields.info: SW channel disable bit.

values.desc: Read: The corresponding channel was not triggered by SW.
Read: The corresponding channel was triggered by SW.

fields.info: Channel priority set bit.

values.desc: Read: The corresponding channel is assigned to the low priority queue.
Read and write: The corresponding channel is assigned to high priority queue.

fields.info: Channel priority reset bit.

values.desc: Read: The corresponding channel is assigned to the low priority queue.
Read: The corresponding channel is assigned to the high priority queue.

registers.name: GCHIENAS
registers.info: Global Channel Interrupt Enable Set Register

fields.info: Global channel interrupt enable bit.

values.desc: Read: The corresponding channel is disabled for interrupt.
Read and write: The corresponding channel is enabled for interrupt.

registers.name: GCHIENAR
registers.info: Global Channel Interrupt Enable Reset Register

fields.info: Global channel interrupt disable bit.

values.desc: Read: The corresponding channel is disabled for interrupt.
Read: The corresponding channel is enabled for interrupt.

fields.info: Channel 0 assignment. This bit field chooses the DMA request assignment for channel 0.
Channel 1 assignment. This bit field chooses the DMA request assignment for channel 1.
Channel 2 assignment. This bit field chooses the DMA request assignment for channel 2.
Channel 3 assignment. This bit field chooses the DMA request assignment for channel 3.
Channel 4 assignment. This bit field chooses the DMA request assignment for channel 4.
Channel 5 assignment. This bit field chooses the DMA request assignment for channel 5.
Channel 6 assignment. This bit field chooses the DMA request assignment for channel 6.
Channel 7 assignment. This bit field chooses the DMA request assignment for channel 7.
Channel 8 assignment. This bit field chooses the DMA request assignment for channel 8.
Channel 9 assignment. This bit field chooses the DMA request assignment for channel 9.
Channel 10 assignment. This bit field chooses the DMA request assignment for channel 10.
Channel 11 assignment. This bit field chooses the DMA request assignment for channel 11.
Channel 12 assignment. This bit field chooses the DMA request assignment for channel 12.
Channel 13 assignment. This bit field chooses the DMA request assignment for channel 13.
Channel 14 assignment. This bit field chooses the DMA request assignment for channel 14.
Channel 15 assignment. This bit field chooses the DMA request assignment for channel 15.
These bit fields determine to which port channel 0 is assigned.
These bit fields determine to which port channel 1 is assigned.
These bit fields determine to which port channel 2 is assigned.
These bit fields determine to which port channel 3 is assigned.
These bit fields determine to which port channel 4 is assigned.
These bit fields determine to which port channel 5 is assigned.
These bit fields determine to which port channel 6 is assigned.
These bit fields determine to which port channel 7 is assigned.
These bit fields determine to which port channel 8 is assigned.
These bit fields determine to which port channel 9 is assigned.
These bit fields determine to which port channel 10 is assigned.
These bit fields determine to which port channel 11 is assigned.
These bit fields determine to which port channel 12 is assigned.
These bit fields determine to which port channel 13 is assigned.
These bit fields determine to which port channel 14 is assigned.
These bit fields determine to which port channel 15 is assigned.
Frame transfer complete (FTC) interrupt to Group A or Group B.
Last frame started (LFS) interrupt to Group A or Group B.
Half block complete (HBC) interrupt to Group A or Group B.
Block transfer complete (BTC) interrupt to Group A or Group B
Bus error (BER) interrupt to Group A or Group B.
Frame transfer complete (FTC) interrupt enable.
Frame transfer complete (FTC) interrupt disable.
Last frame started (LFS) interrupt enable.
Last frame started (LFS) interrupt disable.
Half block complete (HBC) interrupt enable.
Half block complete (HBC) interrupt disable.
Block transfer complete (BTC) interrupt enable.
Block transfer complete (BTC) interurpt disable.
Global interrupt flags.
Frame transfer complete (FTC) flags.
Last frame started (LFS) flags.
Half block transfer (HBC) complete flags.
Block transfer complete (BTC) flags.
Bus error (BER) flags.
These bits should always be programmed as zero.
Channel causing FTC interrupt Group A.
Channel causing LFS interrupt Group A.
Channel causing HBC interrupt Group A.
Channel causing BTC interrupt Group A.
Channel causing BER interrupt Group A.
Channel causing FTC interrupt Group B.
Channel causing LFS interrupt Group B.
Channel causing HBC interrupt Group B.
interrupt for Group B if the corresponding interrupt enable is set.
Channel causing BER interrupt Group B.
Transfers pending for Port B. This flag determines if transfers are ongoing on port B.
Bypass FIFO B.
Priority scheme fix or rotate for high priority queue of Port B.
Priority scheme fix or rotate for low priority queue of Port B.
RAM Test Control.
Channel Number.
DMA debug status.
Debug Enable.
Watch point.
Watch mask.

registers.name: PBACSADDR
registers.info: Port B Active Channel Source Address Register

fields.info: Port B Active Channel Source Address.

registers.name: PBACDADDR
registers.info: Port B Active Channel Destination Address Register

fields.info: address of the active channel as broadcasted in Section 16.3.1.3 for Port B.

registers.name: PBACTC
registers.info: Port B Active Channel Transfer Count Register

fields.info: Port B active channel frame count.
Port B active channel element count.
Error action.
When this bit is set, the parity bits are memory mapped to make them accessible by the CPU.
Parity error detection enable.
Parity Error Detection Flag.
Error address. These bits hold the address of the first parity error generated in the RAM.
Interrupt assignment of region 3 to Group A or Group B.
Interrupt enable of region 3.

values.desc: The interrupt is disabled.
The interrupt is enabled.

fields.info: Region 3 access permission.

values.desc: All accesses are allowed.
Read only accesses are allowed.
Write only accesses are allowed.
No accesses are allowed.

fields.info: Region 3 enable.

values.desc: The region is disabled (no address checking done).
The region is enabled (address and access permission checking done).

fields.info: Interrupt assignment of region 2 to Group A or Group B.

values.desc: The interrupt is routed to the VIM (Group A).
The interrupt is routed to the second CPU (Group B).

fields.info: Interrupt enable of region 2.

values.desc: The interrupt is disabled.
The interrupt is enabled.

fields.info: Region 2 access permission. These bits determine the access permission for region 2.

values.desc: All accesses are allowed.
Read only accesses are allowed.
Write only accesses are allowed.
No accesses are allowed.

fields.info: Region 2 enable.

values.desc: The region is disabled (no address checking done).
The region is enabled (address and access permission checking done).

fields.info: Interrupt assignment of region 1 to Group A or Group B.

values.desc: The interrupt is routed to the VIM (Group A).
The interrupt is routed to the second CPU (Group B).

fields.info: Interrupt enable of region 1.

values.desc: The interrupt is enabled.

fields.info: Region 1 access permission.

values.desc: All accesses are allowed.
Read only accesses are allowed.
Write only accesses are allowed.
No accesses are allowed.

fields.info: Region 1 enable.

values.desc: The region is disabled (no address checking done).
The region is enabled (address and access permission checking done).

fields.info: Interrupt assignment of region 0 to Group A or Group B.

values.desc: The interrupt is routed to the VIM (Group A).
The interrupt is routed to the DSP CPU (Group B).

fields.info: Interrupt enable of region 0.

values.desc: The interrupt is disabled.
The interrupt is enabled.

fields.info: Region 0 access permission. These bits determine the access permission for region 0.

values.desc: All accesses are allowed.
Read only accesses are allowed.
Write only accesses are allowed.
No accesses are allowed.

fields.info: Region 0 enable.

values.desc: The region is disabled (no address checking done).
The region is enabled (address and access permission checking done).

fields.info: Region 3 fault.
Region 2 fault.
Region 1 fault.
Region 0 fault.

registers.name: DMAMPROS

fields.info: End Address defines the address at which the region ends.
